metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8923 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
The zend_string_extend function in Zend/zend_string.h in PHP through 7.1.5 does not prevent changes to string objects that result in a negative length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging a script's use of .= with a long string.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.0-1
php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cli - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-common - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-curl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-dba - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-enchant - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gd - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-imap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-interbase - 8.1.0-1

php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pspell - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-readline - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-snmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-soap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xml - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xsl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-zip - 8.1.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> unfixed upstream as of 2020-06-23 rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 retriage on 2022-02-01 found that upstream fixed it on 2021-08-18, information is now updated to reflect this.

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0-1').
